items.content_html: Did Xcode 9.4 totally change how debugging app extensions works? I used to be able to run an extension target and it would ask what host to attach to. Now it says that it can‚Äôt install the target because the target is not an application.

How cool would it be if Marzipan comes as part of iOS 12.3 in the spring instead of iOS 13? I mean, there‚Äôs no way that could be their big reveal at next year‚Äôs WWDC, right?

I would love to see them go on a Marizpan roadshow in the spring.
Thanks Xcode. I didn‚Äôt actually want to run this app on my phone. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
I‚Äôm so tempted to install iOS 12 Beta 1. I keep hearing how great it is already.

I got RSS feeds being created in Maverick! I still need to automate their generation when a new post is dropped into the posts folder (I probably need to learn about Vapor workers) but I‚Äôm happy to have output being generated.
I think the WWDC State of the Union this afternoon is going to be absolutely amazing.
That WWDC bike demo was the most impressive keynote demo since Phil took a plunge in 99.

Oh, and if it weren‚Äôt enough that this week is WWDC, the Mariners are alone in 1st place in the AL west. I don‚Äôt believe this is happening, I don‚Äôt think it can last, but boy oh boy am I enjoying the crap out of it!
Congratulations to my Apple employee friends for your hard work being revealed to the world today. I‚Äôm excited to see what you‚Äôve been up to!

I‚Äôm completely excited by the lack of leaks and little knowledge of what will be announced at WWDC (aside from the small blunder on Saturday).

Imagine what last year would‚Äôve been like had the HomePod firmware and GM of iOS 11 not leaked? We would have been totally in the dark.
I don‚Äôt know what to think about Microsoft buying GitHub. Should I be happy? Concerned? Thinking about moving all my repos to Bitbucket or self-hosted GitLab?
I‚Äôve never seen two extension ladders leaned up against each other to make one really tall ladder. I hope no one gets hurt!
The next step I want to take is generating the feeds. I want to make full text and microblog versions, with RSS and JSONFeed variants of each.

I‚Äôve started working on my own blog engine. It‚Äôs powered by Vapor 3 and will play nice with short and long-form content. I‚Äôve made pretty good progress in a week. Check it out if you‚Äôre interested. (Full blog post coming when it‚Äôs actually powering my site)

Netflix should release ‚ÄúVHS Mode‚Äù, where watching the same content over and over and over again would degrade the picture over time and eventually snap the tape.

I say this as a parent of boys who are currently on their 1,432nd viewing of the Sarah and Duck show. Make it stop!
A 104.5 temperature is high, right?

This is completely wild. I have an iPhone that‚Äôs tethered to my laptop. My laptop is creating a wireless network, which the phone is joined to. And I‚Äôm still able to proxy my phone through the laptop using Charles. How does this voodoo work??

ü§Ø
I should have done just a little more digging before posting, and I would have found this great library that uses cmark under the hood.
I want to take some Markdown text and convert it to HTML, on Linux and calling it from a Vapor 3 project written in Swift. How would I go about doing this?
I don‚Äôt know much about hockey. But I‚Äôm watching the first game of the Stanley Cup Finals and the score is currently 5-4. Isn‚Äôt that really high?
Dang, I thought I had my Swift Playground woes fixed in Xcode 9.3.1. But alas, I‚Äôm getting the never ending running with this one. I‚Äôm just trying to parse a text file!
Note to self: instead of tweeting about a crazy linter rule at work, petition to have it changed. Make the codebase better rather than whine about it on the interwebs.

I got recommended to try Caddy instead of nginx. I think I have a setup starting to work, but need to figure out how to proxy something from one container to the machine‚Äôs localhost, and have that display using the machine‚Äôs port.
1Password v7 for the Mac is out today! You should go get it. I‚Äôve been on the beta for a while now and it‚Äôs fantastic.
Madness is not being able to find out how nginx is serving localhost:8080 when it‚Äôs not running and nothing is bound to port 8080.
